title: Serializer breaks with custom classes
body_html:
import torch
class A:
    pass
torch.save(A(), 'a.pth')

# File ".../python2.7/site-packages/torch/serialization.py", line 120, in save
#    return _save(obj, f, pickle_module, pickle_protocol)
#  File ".../python2.7/site-packages/torch/serialization.py", line 186, in _save
#    pickler.dump(obj)
#  File ".../python2.7/site-packages/torch/serialization.py", line 150, in persistent_id
#    elif torch.is_storage(obj):
#   File ".../python2.7/site-packages/torch/__init__.py", line 100, in is_storage
#    return obj.__class__ in _storage_classes
# AttributeError: class A has no attribute '__class__'

Is it expected behavior?

Root cause seems to be te that torch.is_tensor(obj) and torch.is_storage(obj) expect an object to have the attribute __class__. And somehow serializer calls torch.is_storage(A) which blows (torch.is_storage(A()) does not).

body:
```python
import torch
class A:
    pass
torch.save(A(), 'a.pth')

# File ".../python2.7/site-packages/torch/serialization.py", line 120, in save
#    return _save(obj, f, pickle_module, pickle_protocol)
#  File ".../python2.7/site-packages/torch/serialization.py", line 186, in _save
#    pickler.dump(obj)
#  File ".../python2.7/site-packages/torch/serialization.py", line 150, in persistent_id
#    elif torch.is_storage(obj):
#   File ".../python2.7/site-packages/torch/__init__.py", line 100, in is_storage
#    return obj.__class__ in _storage_classes
# AttributeError: class A has no attribute '__class__'
```

Is it expected behavior?

Root cause seems to be te that `torch.is_tensor(obj)` and `torch.is_storage(obj)` expect an object to have the attribute `__class__`. And somehow serializer calls `torch.is_storage(A)` which blows (`torch.is_storage(A())` does not).
